remarks.para: All components may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Aircraft performance requirements are satisfied, including Approach Climb and Landing Climb capability,
Jettison nozzle valves are secured closed, and
Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves are secured closed, and
All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Maximum takeoff weight may not exceed the landing climb limit weight at the departure airport plus 16,000 lbs of additional fuel.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "JETTISON FUEL SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Fuel jettison valves are required to be secured in the closed position. Procedures are listed below:

Center wing tank and main tanks 2 and 3 jettison/transfer valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-04/401).
Jettison nozzle valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-05/401).
Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-16-04/401).
Gain access transfer valves through upper wing access panel 573AT (673AT).
Remove and stow the associated electrical connector DV55 (DV50).

Position the associated actuator manual override lever to the closed position. For the #1 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and position down. For the #4 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned up.
Secure the manual override lever with locking wire.
